meanings.definition: To separate or divide into parts or fractions.
meanings.sent1: She was fractionating the cake into equal slices for everyone.
meanings.sent2: The scientist was fractionating the liquid mixture to extract the desired compound.
meanings.sent3: The chef fractionating the ingredients made for a delicious dish.
meanings.sent4: The teacher fractionating the class into groups based on their skills.
meanings.sent5: The mechanic fractionating the engine parts to identify the issue.

meanings.definition: The process of separating a mixture into its components based on their different boiling points.
meanings.sent1: The fractionating of the oil mixture was done to obtain pure components.
meanings.sent2: Fractionating is a common technique used in distillation processes.
meanings.sent3: The fractionating of the colors in the rainbow was a magical sight.
meanings.sent4: The fractionating of opinions in the meeting led to a clear decision.
meanings.sent5: The fractionating of the music notes created a harmonious melody.

meanings.definition: The act of breaking down or analyzing something into smaller parts.
meanings.sent1: The fractionating of the data allowed for a detailed analysis.
meanings.sent2: Fractionating the complex issue into smaller parts made it easier to understand.
meanings.sent3: The fractionating of the story into chapters kept the readers engaged.
meanings.sent4: The fractionating of the painting revealed intricate details.
meanings.sent5: The fractionating of the puzzle pieces helped solve the mystery.
